articles.title: Kim Jong Il Gives On-spot Guidance to Reconstructed Central Zoo
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Gives On-spot Guidance to Reconstructed Central Zoo
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il gave on-the-spot guidance to the Central Zoo reconstructed on an expansion basis.
					 It covers an area of more than a hundred hectares at the foot of picturesque Mt. Taesong.
					
					 After being briefed on the zoo in front of a big painting showing a panoramic view of the zoo, he went round aquarium, tiger, bear and horse sheds and other places for a long while. Learning in detail about the reconstruction and operation of the zoo, he expressed great satisfaction over the fact that the appearance of the zoo has radically changed in a few years.
					
					 He highly praised the constructers for having built a splendid structure and sent thanks to them, noting that the zoo reconstructed on an expansion basis was successfully designed in a peculiar manner and the best quality was ensured in its construction.
					
					 He appreciated the efforts made by Kim Sun Ok, head of the workteam for the tiger shed, who has faithfully worked as an animal breeder for more than four decades, and officials and other workers of the zoo, noting that they have done a lot of work, indeed, at the honorable post for the people's happiness.
					
					 He set forth important tasks which would serve as guidelines for managing and operating the zoo, stressing that it is the pride of the people in the DPRK to have a large modern zoo.
					
					 He said that it is very important to spruce up the zoo well and improve its operation as it is not only a precious treasure of the country to be handed down to the generations to come but is of great significance in the cultural and emotional life of working people and school youth and children and their upbringing and education.
					
					 In order to build the zoo better under a long-term plan it is necessary to increase the species of animals and consolidate its material and technical foundation to serve its purpose, he added. 
					
					 It is important for the zoo to solve the feed problem and establish a veterinary and anti-epidemic system as it breeds a lot of animals of diverse species, he noted, underscoring the need to take thorough-going measures for providing feed suited to the diversity of species of animals and, at the same time, build modern veterinary hospitals.
					
					 He also stressed the need to refurnish the inside and outside of the animal sheds in such a way as to make them convenient to visitors and build facilities sufficient for their rest so that an increasing number of working people and school youth and children may visit the zoo to enjoy a cultural and emotional life.
					
					 There are in the zoo many rare animals including gift animals sent by different countries of the world and it is, therefore, necessary to pay deep attention to the preservation and breeding of them, he said, calling on the zoo to put the breeding and management on a scientific basis.
					
					 He expressed expectation and conviction that the employees of the zoo would successfully perform their honorable mission and duty as servants for people in the future, too.
					
					 He was accompanied by Department Directors of the WPK Central Committee Jang Song Thaek and Kim Yang Gon, First Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Kang Sok Ju, First Vice Department Directors of the WPK Central Committee Ri Je Gang and Ri Jae Il, Chairman of the Radio and TV Broadcasting Committee of the DPRK Cha Sung Su, and other senior officials and KPA Generals Hyon Chol Hae and Ri Myong Su and other commanding officers of the KPA.

articles.title: Greetings to President of United Arab Emirates
articles.content:
Greetings to President of United Arab Emirates
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Monday sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Halifa Bin Zayed Al-Nahayan, President of the United Arab Emirates, on the occasion of the 37th national day of his country.
					 Kim in the message wholeheartedly wished him happiness in good health and greater success in his noble work for the progress and prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Vice-President and PM of United Arab Emirates
articles.content:
Greetings to Vice-President and PM of United Arab Emirates
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK Cabinet, sent a message of greetings to Sheikh Muhammad Bin Rashid Al-Maktoum, vice-president and Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, Monday on the occasion of the 37th national day of his country.
					 Sincerely wishing him greater successes in his noble work for the economic development of his country and the promotion of the people's welfare, the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger in the future.

articles.title: Greetings to Lao President
articles.content:
Greetings to Lao President
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Choummaly Saynasone, President of Laos, on Monday on the occasion of the 33rd anniversary of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					 In the message Kim Yong Nam noted that over the past 33 years after the foundation of the Republic the Lao people have gained great successes in the efforts to achieve national unity and build an independent and prosperous, new society under the correct leadership of the Lao People's Revolutionary Party.
					
					 Sincerely hoping that the Lao people would carry out the decision of the 8th congress of the party and make bigger successes in the efforts to further strengthen the people's democratic system and achieve the prosperity and development of the country, the message expressed the belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the peoples of the two countries forged in the way of the common cause of socialism against imperialism would steadily expand and strengthen in the future, too.

articles.title: Greetings to Lao PM
articles.content:
Greetings to Lao PM
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Premier of the DPRK Cabinet Kim Yong Il sent a message of greetings to Lao Prime Minister Bouasone Bouphavanh on Monday on the occasion of the 33rd anniversary of the foundation of the Lao People's Democratic Republic.
					 The message said that the Prime Minister's visit to the DPRK in August last marked an important occasion in deepening understanding and friendship between the governments and peoples of the two countries and further consolidating and developing the bilateral relations.
					
					 Expressing the belief that the traditional ties of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would continue to develop vigorously, the message sincerely wished him and the Lao government greater successes in the work for prosperity of the country.

articles.title: Greetings to Romanian Foreign Minister
articles.content:
Greetings to Romanian Foreign Minister
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun Monday sent a message of greetings to Romanian Foreign Minister Lazar Comanescu on the occasion of the 90th national day of his country.
					 Hoping that the relations between the two countries would expand and develop in various fields, the message wished him success in his work.

articles.title: Gift to Kim Jong Il
articles.content:
Gift to Kim Jong Il
 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- General Secretary Kim Jong Il received a gift from the General People's Congress of Yemen.
					 The gift was handed to an official concerned on Nov. 30 by Abdullah Ahmed Ghanim, member of the General Committee and head of the Political Department of the congress, on a visit to the DPRK.

articles.title: National Day of Romania Marked
articles.content:
DPRK Boxer Wins Gold Medal
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Iancu Riviu Ovidiu, charge d' affaires ad interim of the Romanian embassy here, gave a reception at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Monday on the occasion of the national day of Romania. 
					 Present there on invitation were Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Pak Kil Yon, Vice-Minister of Education Ryang Hak Sun, Vice-Chairperson of the Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries Hong Son Ok, officials concerned, diplomatic envoys of different countries and representatives of international organizations here. 
					
					 Staff members of the Romanian embassy were present there.
					
					 Speeches were made there.

articles.title: DPRK Boxer Wins Gold Medal
articles.content:
DPRK Boxer Wins Gold Medal
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- DPRK boxer Kim Hyang Ok bagged a gold medal in the 50kg match of the 5th World Women's Boxing Championships held in China from Nov. 22 to 29. 
					 The championships drew women boxers from at least 40 countries and regions.
					
					 She defeated all her rivals with overwhelming edges in the preliminary games. She beat her Chinese rival 6-5 in the quarter-finals and her Philippine rival 7-3 in the semi-finals and her Russian rival 9-2 in the finals.
					
					 Meanwhile, Jong Ok and Ri Suk Yong won bronze medals in the 46kg and 66kg matches of the championships respectively.

articles.title: World AIDS Day Observed
articles.content:
World AIDS Day Observed
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- An event was held at the People's Palace of Culture on Monday on the occasion of the World AIDS Day.
					 Present there were officials of ministries, national institutions and working people's organizations, health workers in the city, staff members of international organizations and staff members of foreign embassies here.
					
					 Ri Pong Hun, vice-minister of Public Health, addressing an opening ceremony, said that AIDS presents itself as a very severe issue worldwide, adding that a work is making successful progress in the DPRK to prevent AIDS.
					
					 He said that the DPRK would further strengthen the work for preventing AIDS in close touch with international bodies and organizations including WHO and the UN AIDS Organization.
					
					 Then the floor was taken by Umesh Gupta, acting representative of WHO here, and Ewa Eriksson Fortier, head of the delegation of the International Federation of Red Cross and Red Crescent Societies, working in the DPRK.
					
					 A lecture titled "Let's actively wage the work for preventing AIDS" was given at the event.
					
					 Its participants looked round photos introducing the successes of the DPRK in the work for preventing AIDS before appreciating a performance given by a hygienic information team.

articles.title: "Complete Collection of Korean Food" Compiled
articles.content:
"Complete Collection of Korean Food" Compiled
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Many traditional national dishes and local special dishes are developed and enriched through energetic discovery in the DPRK.
					 More and more national foods are found and developed through food festivals including national local special food exhibition and national food show, and food contests, lectures and short courses.
					
					 Flour food, sea cucumber dish and meat dish were proved as time-honored national foods peculiar to Korea.
					
					 The sort of traditional dishes is ever increasing including bean food, rice gruel mixed with red-bean, rice-cake soup, steamed food, baked food, fried food, meat boiled on a skewer, pan-broiled food, slices of raw fish or meat, broth, beef with vegetables cooked in casserole, thin stew of vegetables and meat and etc.
					
					 In the staple foods, the number of rice-cake soup amounts to more than 200, that of boiled rice to over 160 and that of noodle to above 40. Varied are the kinds of kimchi, specialty of the nation. 
					
					 So far, more than 6,000 kinds of national food have been compiled in the book.

articles.title: Korea, Home of Soybean
articles.content:
Korea, Home of Soybean
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Korea is the home of soybean which is one of the main crops worldwide.
					A wild bean evolved into a semi-domesticated species of soybean was cultivated from more than 6,000 years ago and a Korean subspecies of soybean began to be planted from 4,500 odd years ago in Korea.
					
					A semi-domesticated species of soybean distributed only in Korea and some other areas was founded in Juche 61 (1972) and researches by scholars proved that it was evolved from a wild bean over 6,000 years ago.
					
					It has been scientifically confirmed that domesticated soybean today was derived from it. Hence it has been proved that the home of soybean is Korea and some areas around it where Koreans lived.
					
					From the biological point of view, there are more than 40 species of bean (Glycine in scientific name) but most of them are wild plants and afore-said soybean is the only one actually cultivated today.
					
					This soybean species was divided into several subspecies and varieties to be disseminated worldwide through China and Japan.
					
					There are four subspecies of soybean in the world now. Among them, the Korean subspecies is yellow and big more than the other subspecies and its stalk grows straight.
					
					This means that the evolutionary history of the Korean subspecies is the longest and Korea is the home of soybean.
					
					The discovery of burnt soybeans in the Odong remains in Hoeryong City, North Hamgyong Province, and the Namgyong remains in Samsok District, Pyongyang, tells us that soybean was grown as one of the normal crops and used in dietary life in all parts of Korea already from thousands of years ago.
					
					Being the first cultivator of soybean, Korea led the van in developing soybean food and its processing technique, which found their way to many countries worldwide. Now they run into hundreds of kinds.

articles.title: Anti-DPRK "Resolution on Human Rights" Rebutted
articles.content:
Anti-DPRK "Resolution on Human Rights" Rebutted
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- An anti-DPRK "resolution on human rights" was railroaded through the meeting of the 3rd Committee of the 63rd UN General Assembly.
					 This "resolution" fabricated by Japan and the EU with a political motive to tarnish the image of the DPRK in the international arena is peppered with lies and fabrications.
					
					 That was why the majority of the UN member nations said no or abstained from voting, questioning the "resolution" as it was a vivid manifestation of politicization and double-dealing standards in dealing with a human rights issue.
					
					 The DPRK categorically rebuffs and condemns the "resolution" as a wanton infringement upon the inviolable dignity and sovereignty of the DPRK since it totally negates the advantages of Korean-style socialism.
					
					 The DPRK is a genuine country of the people and a socialist state centered on the popular masses in which they have become the masters of the state and society and everything serves them.
					
					 It regards it as a fundamental idea guiding the nation-building and a starting point in state activities to believe in people as in Heaven. The state, therefore, is fully responsible for guaranteeing the rights of all citizens to the end.
					
					 Under the benevolent socialist system, the Korean people are leading a worthwhile and happy life as masters of the country and society and creditably fulfilling the responsibility and role as masters. All of them are participating in the exercise of power and state administration with equal rights and leading a worthwhile political life, affiliated to certain political organizations. They are given ample opportunity of learning and keeping themselves in good health thanks to free education and free medical care systems and various popular policies.
					
					 The independent and creative life the Korean people enjoy is a dignified worthwhile and happy life unimaginable in the capitalist society. 
					
					 This clearly proves that the above-said "resolution" cooked up with Japan and the EU as main players is a product of the sinister political plot to stifle socialism in the DPRK as the "resolution" totally disregarded its reality. 
					
					 As for Japan and some countries of the EU that spearheaded the fabrication of the "resolution," they are not entitled to say anything about someone's "human rights performance" in the international arena.
					
					 It is because these countries committed worst human rights abuses in history by perpetrating wars of aggression and genocide against other countries for centuries.
					
					 It was none other than Japan and member nations of the EU that dispatched their troops to the Iraqi war started by the U.S. in the new century.
					
					 The Iraqi war is state-sponsored terrorism and the most hideous human rights abuse as human rights were seriously violated by ultra-modern means of war and mediaeval methods.
					
					 Unceasing xenophobia, discrimination against minorities and all sorts of crimes and infringement upon rights of people by law enforcement organs, etc., rampant in the Western countries are also hideous human rights abuses.
					
					 In the light of the historical facts and what is happening in their own countries, they have neither moral right nor legal right to talk about someone's "human rights issues." It is the tragedy and disgrace for humankind to see such worst human right abusers utter words about human rights.
					
					 If they wish to talk about human rights issues at the UN so much, they had better begin taking issues with the human rights abuses committed by them in the past and being perpetrated by them in different parts of the world at present. 
					
					 It is not for the sake of people of other countries that the Western forces are vociferating about "human rights issues." In doing so, they seek a sinister aim to cover up their crime-woven history in which they savagely trampled down upon people's right to existence and other vital rights for centuries.
					
					 The "human rights racket" of the West is aimed to meet its own interests and nothing but a move to westernize the whole world. 
					
					 The West is behaving as if it were "a human rights judge" whose role is characterized by politicization and double-dealing standards in handling human rights issues, arrogant admonition and undisguised interference in others' internal affairs. This is only sparking off distrust and confrontation among countries, far from helping various countries improve human rights records. 
					
					 The DPRK can neither pardon nor overlook the behaviors of Japan and the EU infringing upon its dignity and interests over its "human rights issue." 
					
					 The ever-more intensified "human rights" offensive of the hostile forces of the West would only compel the DPRK to reinforce all the measures to defend its sovereignty under the uplifted banner of Songun, more deeply enshrining the truth that human rights precisely mean sovereignty.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak Group Can Never Evade Blame for Deteriorated Inter-Korean Relations
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak Group Can Never Evade Blame for Deteriorated Inter-Korean Relations
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Lee Myung Bak group is taking issue with the just step taken by the DPRK to strictly restrict and cut off all the overland passages through the Military Demarcation Line from December 1 as the first measure, terming it a "very regretful one" and "violation of the agreed points". Echoing this, the ultra-right conservative forces including the "Grand National Party" are slandering the just step of the DPRK as "a habitual threat" and "hold-out-to-the-last strategy".
					 Commenting on this, Rodong Sinmun today terms these outbursts sophism and vituperation intended to evade their blame for having pushed the north-south relations to catastrophe and mislead public opinion at home and abroad and an unpardonable provocation to the DPRK.
					
					 The step taken by the DPRK is very just as it is an expression of the resolute principled stand and will of the DPRK not to pardon the group of traitors' criminal acts of daring hurt the supreme dignity of the DPRK and driving the situation on the Korean Peninsula to the brink of a war after pushing the inter-Korean relations to the phase of total collapse, seized with the consciousness of confrontation with fellow countrymen, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 With no rhetoric can the Lee group evade the blame for having pushed the inter-Korean relations to the danger of total severance or cover up its true colors as anti-reunification elements and warmongers keen to do harm to fellow countrymen at any cost in league with foreign forces.
					
					 Steadfast is the principled stand of the DPRK. It always does as determined to do. It does not make any empty talk.
					
					 Prompted by the sense of the heavy responsibility for the destiny of the country and the nation, we will never overlook the reckless acts the group of traitors have perpetrated by standing in the way of implementing the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration and driving the inter-Korean relations to a catastrophic phase of total severance through unprecedented confrontational racket against the DPRK but resolutely counter them. 
					
					 The fate of the inter-Korean relations entirely depends on the attitude of the authorities of the south side.

articles.title: Repeal of NSL in S. Korea Demanded
articles.content:
Repeal of NSL in S. Korea Demanded
 Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- The Korean Jurists Institute on Sunday released a white paper disclosing the treacherous and anti-reunification nature of "the National Security Law."
					 The white paper cited facts that the NSL has served as a hurdle in the way of achieving national reconciliation, unity and reunification of the country and a check-bar blocking the progress of south Korean society as it is nothing but a tool for maintaining the U.S. imperialists' colonial rule and ensuring "the security" of the successive sycophantic and traitorous regimes over the last six decades since it was promulgated and enforced on December 1, 1948 in south Korea.
					
					 Referring to the background against which the NSL, an unprecedented evil law, was cooked up and revised retrogressively, the white paper said:
					
					 The NSL, which has undergone a retrogressive revision to have four chapters and 25 articles and supplementary rules year after year, is the most draconic law under the south Korean "legal system" aimed at blocking the democratization of society and the reunification of the country and antagonizing the DPRK. 
					
					 The NSL has legal premises to block national reconciliation, unity and reunification of the country by regarding fellow countrymen with hostility.
					
					 As the NSL does not recognize the party concerned with reunification it totally denies dialogue and negotiations for reunification and bars compatriots from having any discussion and contact and achieving national reconciliation and unity. 
					
					 It is a law against democracy and human rights as it is aimed at suppressing the righteous struggle of the south Korean people for social democracy and the reunification of the country.
					
					 The present June 15 era of reunification demands a total repeal of the NSL, a hurdle in the way of achieving inter-Korean reconciliation, cooperation and the reunification of the country. 
					
					 The south Korean authorities should face up to the trend of the times and repeal the NSL at once.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak group of traitors is using the NSL, a fascist law which should have already been thrown into the dumping ground of history, as an all-powerful means for putting an end to the June 15 era of reunification and ensuring "the security of its power."
					
					 The Korean Jurists Institute brands these suppressive actions as traitorous and anti-reunification acts and human rights abuses and bitterly denounces them on behalf of all the jurists of the DPRK.
					
					 Should the Lee Myung Bak group persist in invoking the NSL, going against the unanimous demands of the Koreans at home and abroad and the June 15 era of reunification, it will stand more thoroughly isolated and more bitterly rebuffed by all Koreans and world people and will have to pay a dear price for its crimes.
					
					 The Lee Myung Bak regime's more desperate use of the NSL would only precipitate its self-destruction.

articles.title: Puppet Authorities' Anti-Reunification Moves Slammed in S. Korea
articles.content:
Puppet Authorities' Anti-Reunification Moves Slammed in S. Korea
Pyongyang, December 1 (KCNA) -- Members of civic and social organizations in south Korea, including the South Headquarters of the National Alliance for the Country's Reunification and the Solidarity for Progress, held a meeting in Seoul on Nov. 28 to denounce the anti-reunification moves of the puppet authorities refusing to implement the June 15 joint declaration and the October 4 declaration.
					 At the meeting speakers charged that the malicious hostile policy toward fellow countrymen pursued by the Lee Myung Bak "government" and the "Grand National Party" has bedeviled the inter-Korean relations.
					
					 It is treachery to totally deny the June 15 joint declaration, a landmark for reunification, they said, declaring that people from all walks of life would stage a large-scale struggle from December in denunciation of the "government's" crime committed in having bedeviled the south-north relations.
					
					 At the end of the meeting the participants went on a sit-in, holding placards in their hands.
					
					 On the same day, figures of organizations for the progressive movement, including the Pusan Headquarters of the South Side Committee for Implementing the June 15 Joint Declaration, the Pusan Solidarity for Citizens' Movement and the Pusan Council of Women's Organizations, too, called a press conference in Pusan, urging the puppet authorities to repeal their hostile policy toward the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il dirige el Parque Zoologico Nacional
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il dirige el Parque Zoologico Nacional
Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Dirigente Kim Jong Il, Secretario General del Partido del Trabajo de Corea y Presidente del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea, dirigio sobre el terreno el reconstruido y ampliado Parque Zoologico Nacional, que ocupa una extensa superficie de mas de 100 hectareas al pie del pintoresco monte Taesong.
					  Tras escuchar explicaciones ante el plano del parque, el Dirigente recorrio durante varias horas el acuario, las jaulas de tigre, oso, caballo y otros lugares averiguando en detalles el estado de reconstruccion y administracion y se mostro muy satisfecho por la fisonomia del parque renovada en unos anos.
					
					  Senalando que este parque reconstruido y extendido fue disenado originalmente y construido en el maximo nivel cualitativo, expreso agradecimiento a los constructores de esta magnifica obra apreciando mucho sus meritos.
					
					  El Dirigente elogio los esfuerzos de los funcionarios y obreros como la jefa de la brigada de trabajo encargada de la jaula de tigre, Kim Sun Ok, quien lleva mas de 40 anos trabajando con fidelidad como criadora, destacando que ellos realizaron muchos trabajos en este puesto sagrado por la felicidad del pueblo.
					
					  Acto seguido, presento las tareas programaticas que serviran de guia en la administracion y operacion indicando que este moderno parque zoologico de gran tamano es un orgullo del pueblo coreano.
					
					  Puesto que el Parque Zoologico Nacional es un valioso patrimonio del pais digno de legar a las generaciones venideras y tiene gran importancia en la vida cultural y la educacion de los trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares,  acondicionarlo bien y mejorar su operacion resultan una labor muy importante, apunto.
					
					  Para acondicionar mejor con vistas al futuro este parque, es preciso aumentar mas el numero de las especies animales de aqui y consolidar por consiguiente su base material y tecnica, enseno.
					
					  Destaco la importancia de resolver el problema de pienso y establecer el sistema de prevencion veterinaria en este lugar donde se crian muchos animales de varias especies y anadio que se debe tomar consecuentemente las correspondientes medidas de cebadura y construir al mismo tiempo modernos hospitales veterinarios.
					
					  Subrayo que hay que remodelar la parte interior y la exterior de los establos garantizando mas confort para la visita y acondicionar suficientes facilidades necesarias al descanso, de modo que el mayor numero de trabajadores, jovenes y ninos escolares puedan disfrutar de vida cultural en este lugar.
					
					  Dado que aqui habitan especies raras y valiosas incluso los animales provenientes de varios paises del mundo como regalo, se debe prestar profunda atencion a la conservacion y reproduccion de ellas e impulsar de manera cientifica el cuidado y la cria.
					
					  Por ultimo, el Dirigente expreso la esperanza y conviccion de que los empleados del parque zoologico seguiran cumpliendo magnificamente en lo adelante tambien su honrosa mision y deber de servidor al pueblo.
					
					  Le acompanaron los jefes de departamento del Comite Central del PTC, Jang Song Thaek y Kim Yang Gon, el primer viceministro de Relaciones Exteriores Kang Sok Ju, los primeros subjefes de departamento del CC del PTC, Ri Je Gang y Ri Jae Il, el presidente del Comite Nacional de Radio y Television de Corea Cha Sung Su y otros cuadros directivos, los generales de ejercito del EPC, Hyon Chol Hae y Ri Myong Su y otros directivos del ejercito.

articles.title: Acto por el "Dia Mundial de SIDA"
articles.content:
Acto por el "Dia Mundial de SIDA"
Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ATCC) -- Tuvo lugar este lunes en el capitalino Palacio Cultural del Pueblo el acto por el "Dia Mundial de SIDA".
					Asistieron los funcionarios de los ministerios, organos centrales y organizaciones de masas, trabajadores de salud publica en la capital.
					
					Tambien participaron los integrantes de las representaciones de organizaciones internacionales y los miembros de embajadas de varios paises, acreditados en Corea.
					
					El viceministro coreano de Salud Publica, Ri Pong Hun, en su discurso inaugural, dijo que el SIDA resulta un serio problema en escala mundial y se refirio a que en Corea se lleva adelante con exito la prevencion de ese flagelo.
					
					Subrayo que Corea fortalecera mas la prevencion del SIDA en estrecha relacion con la OMS, la Organizacion contra SIDA de la ONU y otras organizaciones y entidades internacionales. 
					
					Seguidamente, hicieron uso de la palabra Umesh Gupta, representante a.i. de la OMS en Corea, y Ewa Eriksson Portier, jefe de la delegacion de la Federacion Internacional de las Sociedades de la Cruz Roja y Medialuna Roja, quien trabaja en Corea. 
					
					En la ocasion se impartio una conferencia intitulada "Despleguemos activamente la labor para prevenir el SIDA". 
					
					Los participantes recorrieron las fotos alusivas a los exitos logrados en Corea en la prevencion de ese mal y vieron una funcion artistica del grupo de propaganda higienica.

articles.title: Coreana gana medalla de oro en V Campeonato Mundial de Boxeo (F)
articles.content:
Coreana gana medalla de oro en V Campeonato Mundial de Boxeo (F)
Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ATCC) -- La boxeadora coreana Kim Hyang Ok obtuvo la medalla de oro en el partido de la categoria del 50 kg del V Campeonato Mundial de Boxeo (F) efectuado del 22 al 29 de noviembre en China con la participacion de boxeadoras procedentes de mas de 40 paises y regiones del mundo.
					　Ella vencio a sus rivales en la competencia eliminatoria con la diferencia absoluta de notas y en el cuarto de final gano a la jugadora china con 6 por 5, en la semifinal a la filipina con 7 por 3 y en final a la rusa con 9 por 2, respectivamente.
					
					　Por otra parte, la boxeadora Jong Ok y Ri Suk Yong ganaron la medalla de bronce en las competencias de la categoria de 46 kg y 66 kg, respectivamente.

articles.title: IJC revela caracter antinacional de "ley de seguridad"
articles.content:
IJC revela caracter antinacional de "ley de seguridad" 
Pyongyang, 1 de diciembre (ATCC) -- El Instituto de Juristas de Corea hizo publica el 30 de noviembre la Carta Blanca para revelar el caracter antinacional y anti-reunificacion de la "ley de seguridad" del Sur de Corea.
					esta "ley", que el primero de diciembre de 1948 entro en vigencia en el Sur de Corea, vino sirviendo durante 60 anos pasados de un medio favorable a la dominacion colonial de los imperialistas norteamericanos y a la "seguridad de mandato" de los sucesivos "poderes" surcoreanos serviles a grandes potencias. 
					
					En ese lapso esta infame ley cumplio el papel de escollo de la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales y la reunificacion de la patria y de traba para impedir el progreso de la sociedad surcoreana, senala el documento y revela el curso de creacion y modificacion  de esta infame ley nunca vista. 
					
					La "ley de seguridad", modificada peor por 25 articulos de 4 capitulos y una regla suplementaria, ocupa el primer lugar del "sistema legitimo" del Sur de Corea que frena la democratizacion de la sociedad y la reunificacion de la patria y hostiliza a la RPDC.
					
					Tambien establece la premisa legitima para hostilizar a los connacionales e impedir la reconciliacion y unidad nacionales y la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					   Este aparato legal niega el dialogo y las negociaciones por la reunificacion, al no reconocer a la contraparte de esta empresa, e impide la discusion y contacto entre los connacionales, la reconciliacion y la unidad de la nacion. 
					
					Ademas, esta infame ley antidemocratica y anti-DDHH reprime la lucha justa de la poblacion surcoreana por la democratizacion de la sociedad y la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					  La actual epoca de reunificacion iniciada el 15 de Junio exige la anulacion completa de la "ley de seguridad" que traba la reconciliacion y la cooperacion entre el Norte y el Sur y la reunificacion de la patria. 
					
					  Las autoridades surcoreanas deben darse clara cuenta de la tendencia de la epoca y cancelar sin demora la "ley de seguridad". 
					
					  El IJC califica del crimen antinacional, anti-reunificacion y anti-DDHH la represion de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak, que recurre a la infame ley fascista de la caduca epoca y la utiliza como aparato omnipotente para acabar con la epoca de reunificacion del 15 de junio y lograr la "seguridad de mandato" de su poder, y la denuncia categoricamente a nombre de todos los juristas de la RPDC. 
					
					  Si la banda de Lee Myung Bak sigue recurriendo a esa ley fascista antinacional y anti-reunificacion, nadando a contrapelo de la unanime demanda interior y exterior y de la corriente de la epoca de reunificacion del 15 de junio, no podra evadir el mayor aislamiento y repudio por parte de toda la nacion coreana y los demas pueblos del mundo y pagara el precio caro. 
					
					  Cuanto mas el "poder" de Lee recurre a la "ley de seguridad", tanto mas se adelantara su autodestruccion.
